svcproc.title: ENGINE WARNING AND PROTECTION SYSTEM
svcproc.para: This group of parameters customizes the engine warning and protection feature. The Engine Warning and Protection System safeguards the engine from undesirable operating conditions in order to prevent engine damage and to prolong engine life. When a warning condition is detected, the on-board electronics will light up the OIL/WATER lamp and the Warning buzzer is activated.

When a critical condition is detected, the on-board electronics will shut down the engine if the engine warning and protection system has the protection feature enabled. After an engine shutdown, the operator may restart the engine for a thirty second run time if desired.

The event logging feature will also record when an excessive (ie., critical) engine event has occurred in both engine hours and odometer readings. Currently there are four states of electronic operation.
